alert.note: Alert for Allegheny; Beaver; Butler (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 07 at 7:35AM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of southwest, west central, and western Pennsylvania, including the following counties, in southwest Pennsylvania, Allegheny. In west central Pennsylvania, Butler. In western Pennsylvania, Beaver. * WHEN...Until 830 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 735 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain has fallen due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.9 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Cranberry, Franklin Park, Economy, Ambridge, Wexford, Baden, Harmony Township, Seven Fields, Bell Acres, Bradfordwoods, Warrendale and Pine Township. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
